title: Projects
text:
Developed machine learning models for risk assessment and pricing in the insurance sector, helping improve underwriting decisions and profitability.



Research focused on dimensionality reduction and image compression using Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT). Developed efficient approximate transforms for signal processing.

title: Projects
text: Developed machine learning models for risk assessment and pricing in the insurance sector, helping improve underwriting decisions and profitability.

title: Home
text:
Welcome! 👋
I’m Anabeth Radunz, a Data Scientist with a passion for turning data into meaningful insights.
With a background in Statistics (Bachelor’s, Master’s, and PhD), I specialize in data analysis, machine learning, and applied research. I enjoy solving complex problems and transforming data into actionable solutions for businesses.
This website is a space where you can learn more about my background, projects, and experience. Feel free to connect!

title: About
text:
Hello! I’m Anabeth Radunz, a Data Scientist passionate about data-driven solutions, statistics, and technology.
I hold a PhD in Statistics, and over the past years, I’ve worked in risk modeling, data science, and research. My expertise includes machine learning, statistical modeling, and signal processng.
I enjoy collaborating with teams, solving challenging problems, and communicating data insights in an accessible way to both technical and non-technical audiences.



Programming: Python, SQL, R, Matlab
Data Science: Machine Learning, Statistical Modeling, Data Visualization
Cloud & Tools: Google Cloud (GCP), AWS, Git
Data Tools: Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch





🎓 PhD in Statistics – Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE)
🎓 Master’s in Statistics – Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE)
🎓 Bachelor’s in Statistics – Federal University of Santa Maria (UFSM)

title: CV
text:
Allianz Seguros – Rio de Janeiro, Brazil | 2023 – Present
- Worked on risk modeling, pricing models, and claims analysis.
- Automated data workflows and improved model deployment processes.



Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE) | 2017 – 2023
- Research in signal processing, data compression, and pattern recognition.
- Published academic papers and developed algorithms for dimensionality reduction.
